reviews.review: okay so i cant beleive the i gave this movie a 3 star but the problem was that it lost its magic its funny action packed but the movie just lacked the true magic of before and i loved olaf just like before and its a good christmas time treat but just dont over expect

I wanted to like it, I really did. It just fell completely flat for me. The songs were immediately forgettable (literally--I couldn't remember one lyric after leaving). As one reviewer said, the plot was simultaneously confusing and full of holes while still somehow managing to be totally predicable. The characters also acted out-of-character. Some of the scenes and at least one musical number felt more like a parody to me than like I was supposed to take them seriously. My kids, who were die-hard fans of the first movie, were also thoroughly unimpressed. Animation was good, that's about the only positive thing I can say.
very enjoyable. almost as good as the original. Definitely recommend.

The whole story I loved. It gave a true story about growing up and learning how to make the right choice even if it feels bad.
My only dislike was too many songs. I know they helped with the progression but it was still too many.

Great for the kids a must see.  Just upset with the whole plot there was no hiccups in the movie.  Elsa went straight to what she needed to do one hiccup there her sister frees this situation with absolutely no problem then the movie is over.  The movie needed more imo.

This movie was so good! As always, such a great story! Disney knows how to really touch in heart strings! 
The songs I wasnt a big fan of but it was cute!
I definitely go see it again. My 9 yo daughter  wasnt the biggest fan. Boo!
Thought it was better than the first!!! Loved it!

I was a bit iffy about watching this because sequels lately are kind of bad. However, my thoughts changed just as soon as the movie started. The movie had me and my family laughing, smiling and crying throughout the entire time. One scene in particular made me cry the most and no spoilers but it was even sadder when I thought Anna died in the first one.

A fun, family friendly film that will keep your kids entertained.  While the second Frozen film doesn't pack quite the Grand-Slam punch that the original film nailed, it has some catchy tunes that only Disney could pull off with an animated narrative.
